hints.content:
Let's begin by plotting the three given points of our square on a graph with grid marks:  

![](https://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/4478c66ab0d5f15cae46ff5ec6e370a02922e8c5.png)

We can see that point $D$ will have an $x$-coordinate of $-8$ and a $y$-coordinate of $7$.  So point $D$ is $(-8,7)$.

![](https://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/5ddb76b528d0d1b8970f608ad1986c6edddf04fa.png)

question.content:
You are graphing Square $ABCD$ in the coordinate plane.  The following are three of the vertices of the square:
$A(-8, 3), B(-4, 3),$ and $C(-4, 7)$.  

**What are the coordinates of point $D$?**

$\large($ [[☃ input-number 1]], [[☃ input-number 2]] $\large)$

![](https://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/6dc495c1ca92d62c6e629fccf129dae9036d49ac.png)
